Question 72) Montaigne named a new literary genre; It was one of the first to institute in modern literature a private space, the space of the “I”, of the intimate text. It creates a new process of philosophical writing, in which hesitation, self -criticism, corrections enter the text itself.
The new genre of writing alluded to the text is the
A) Confession, which reports transformation experiences.
B) essay, which exposes subjective conceptions of a theme.
C) Letter, which communicates information to an acquaintance.
D) Meditation, which proposes preparations for knowledge.
E) dialogue, which discusses issues with different interlocutors.
